item.title: Debra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Debra add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Debra add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Debra add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Debra add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When I look back, I am so impressed again with the life-giving power of literature. If I were a young person today, trying to gain a sense of myself in the world, I would do that again by reading, just as I did when I was young." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Debra add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Debra add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Somebody who only reads newspapers and at best books of contemporary authors looks to me like an extremely near-sighted person who scorns eyeglasses. He is completely dependent on the prejudices and fashions of his times, since he never gets to see or hear anything else." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Debra add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Debra add a quote by Germaine Greer
item.description: "A library is a place where you can lose your innocence without losing your virginity." -- Germaine Greer

item.title: Debra add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"Libraries should be open to all - except the censor.
<i>[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "There are certain shades of limelight that can wreck a girl's complexion." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "would you reach in the drawer there and give me my purse. A girl doesn't read this sort of thing without her lipstick." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "To me, the greatest pleasure of writing is not what it's about, but the music the words make." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Leave it to me: I'm always top banana in the shock department." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "There were hints of sunrise on the rim of the sky, yet it was still dark, and the traces of morning color were like goldfish swimming in ink." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "there is only one unpardonable sin--deliberate cruelty. All else can be forgiven." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Everybody has to feel superior to somebody," she said. "But it's customary to present a little proof before you take the privilege." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Debra add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Debra add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Debra add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Debra add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Debra add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Debra add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Debra add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Debra add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Debra add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Debra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde
